definition: to swarm around/flocking (to see)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: When the bus arrived, the children all piled on it.
sentences.chinese: 汽车一到，孩子们一拥而上。

sentences.english: It's been a buzz of media there hinting someone stole it.
sentences.chinese: 媒体一拥而上，暗示一些人偷了总统的手表。

sentences.english: The lorry drew up and the waiting people piled on.
sentences.chinese: 卡车停了下来，等候着的人就一拥而上。

sentences.english: The Ewoks overpowered Mace and tied him up to take him back to their village.
sentences.chinese: 伊渥克一拥而上把梅斯绑了起来，抬回了村子。

definition: to surround/to gird
to swarm in (of people etc) (idiom)
to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
to crowd around
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
lit. like wolves and tigers/ruthless
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
to scatter in all directions
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast
pinyin: bu4 guan3 san1 qi1 er4 shi2 yi1

definition: to attack with a bladed weapon
to push and shove
to shout
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
to shout an order or command
